TopicTitle: [1.8.x] In game notes / notepad / checklist v0.16 2019/10/23

Articles.Content:
I just tried this out in a new linux install, and was saddened to see the game wouldn't load with Notes installed. The game would stop loading and shut down when it got to notes. I removed the mod and the game started.

Entirely possible it's something I did wrong, being a total linux noob.

I don't know. I have the game running on linux 64 bits with notes enabled.

Sad thing though, Alt+L does not lock the keys and neither the checkbox

Just wanted to say thanks again for your contribution to the Kerbal world...

Your mods are all so simple yet so useful, I consider them to be naturally part of the game. I've been notepad for about a year now and still it's one of my most used mods.

So thanks for your work and happy holidays!

I don't know. I have the game running on linux 64 bits with notes enabled.

Sad thing though, Alt+L does not lock the keys and neither the checkbox

Hi Baleine, don't have much time to play right now, I'll look at this when I have some spare time (mostly in a week). In the meanwhile the log file can be useful to do a first look into.

Just wanted to say thanks again for your contribution to the Kerbal world...

Your mods are all so simple yet so useful, I consider them to be naturally part of the game. I've been notepad for about a year now and still it's one of my most used mods.

So thanks for your work and happy holidays!

Glad you find it useful jokerwildcat, happy holidays to you too
Can I add it to the CKAN? It's a very useful mod manager, if you haven't heard.

Can I add it to the CKAN? It's a very useful mod manager, if you haven't heard.

Be free to add it if you want

Salud.
this is not compatible with .90 !
You're going to have to be more specific -- I've used it successfully on 0.90.
he might just be reacting to the AVC message at startup

no I dont get an AVC message , to be more specific the game crashes at loading when the title Notes appears. You know the yellow progress bar? The 10.0 version , although 1 version older works like a champ It even supports control lockout as well!

Edited January 13, 2015 by lextacy
Dunno what to tell you then, loads fine for me under 0.90 Win7 x86. Given that you mentioned control lockout, I assume you're on Linux
I'm running it fine under Linux x64. It happened to crash before, but this was because file permissions were wrong.
I retract my statement in when I said the older version was working. It worked only 1 time. Im on Linux so I would need the later versions to benefit from the lockout bug.
As I was saying the last version is working. Just be careful that files in GameData have read/write permissions for the user launching KSP.

Sorry for the silly question... I'm new to this mod stuff. But do you extract this to the gamedata folder just like the other mods? Because I can't get this to show up anywhere when I do. And it places a gamedata folder within my gamedata folder, Is it supposed to? Basically the the path ends up like this....C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\Gamedata\notes I have succesfully installed other mods. Thanks for any help.

I rather think you want the "notes" folder to be in "C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\"

Mind you, You have to trigger the mod with the shortcut keys in order to see it open. If you're unclear wether the mod been loaded or not, you may check in C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP.log (search for the "notes" string)

Yes... That's what I'm saying. When I extract straight from the zip file to the gamedata folder, it automatically creates the other gamedata folder. I suppose I can live without it, and just stay with the notebook and pencil method..

Then you just have to move the "notes" folder from "C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\Gamedata\" to "C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\"

That's not that difficult, you'll see.

no I dont get an AVC message , to be more specific the game crashes at loading when the title Notes appears. You know the yellow progress bar? The 10.0 version , although 1 version older works like a champ It even supports control lockout as well!

Looks like same issue. I'm getting Segmentation fault on game loading when mod is present in GameData folder. On Linux x86_64 version 0.90.

Not happening on stock version. Trying to find what is conflicting.

Update: It is somehow related to ActiveTextureManagement agressive version. After some messing around got "notes" folder under ActiveTextureManagement/textureCache and copying it to non-working GameData definitely helps. So, another attempt was to renaming "notes" to "0_notes" and it is also helps. Looks like memory issue?

Edited February 23, 2015 by ThirdOfSeven
More info

Still works on 1.0, make noise if there's any problem.

Salud.

Still works on 1.0, make noise if there's any problem.

Salud.

Just because it functions with no user-visible symptoms doesn't mean it's working properly. Often times mismatched mods can throw silent errors that accumulate behind the scenes, often not causing gameplay symptoms until deep into a play session.

... That said, the KerbalStuff page for this mod flags it as 1.0 compatible. Without the mod author editing this OP to reflect that, or any other reference in the KerbalStuff description to indicate 1.0 compatibility, I've been burnt before. Regardless, I'll try it.

Just because it functions with no user-visible symptoms doesn't mean it's working properly. Often times mismatched mods can throw silent errors that accumulate behind the scenes, often not causing gameplay symptoms until deep into a play session.

... That said, the KerbalStuff page for this mod flags it as 1.0 compatible. Without the mod author editing this OP to reflect that, or any other reference in the KerbalStuff description to indicate 1.0 compatibility, I've been burnt before. Regardless, I'll try it.

In fairness, that -IS- the mod author you quoted....

Great mod.

Tho ... erm ... notes from me about features I miss:

- add "New document" button to main window.

- replace document deletion method: delete button always visible, but popup window shown at deleting document with warning: "You are about to delete this document,{Name}, if you really want to do so, click those two red switches down." Because hiding/showing delete button do not stops you from accidentally deleting wrong document, or several in row instead of one.

Great mod.

Tho ... erm ... notes from me about features I miss:

- add "New document" button to main window.

- replace document deletion method: delete button always visible, but popup window shown at deleting document with warning: "You are about to delete this document,{Name}, if you really want to do so, click those two red switches down." Because hiding/showing delete button do not stops you from accidentally deleting wrong document, or several in row instead of one.

All seems reasonable, thanks for the suggestions. I'll try to incorporate that in next version, no ETA as always .

Salud.

I'd also like to...note... that on occasion I've accidentally used the Load button on the text window thinking it will let me open a new text file but actually reloads the current one and I would lose any changes made. A save warning would be nice, or relabeling it to Reload or something

I just tried this out in a new linux install, and was saddened to see the game wouldn't load with Notes installed. The game would stop loading and shut down when it got to notes. I removed the mod and the game started.

Entirely possible it's something I did wrong, being a total linux noob.

no I dont get an AVC message , to be more specific the game crashes at loading when the title Notes appears. You know the yellow progress bar? The 10.0 version , although 1 version older works like a champ It even supports control lockout as well!
I'm running it fine under Linux x64. It happened to crash before, but this was because file permissions were wrong.
Looks like same issue. I'm getting Segmentation fault on game loading when mod is present in GameData folder. On Linux x86_64 version 0.90.

Not happening on stock version. Trying to find what is conflicting.

Update: It is somehow related to ActiveTextureManagement agressive version. After some messing around got "notes" folder under ActiveTextureManagement/textureCache and copying it to non-working GameData definitely helps. So, another attempt was to renaming "notes" to "0_notes" and it is also helps. Looks like memory issue?

Im having a somewhat similar issue to these guys.

I say somewhat similar, in that its hard to nail down EXACT steps to get this fault.

For instance, my current install on 64 bit linux will not get past notes in the loading screen. Removing notes fixes this problem. However, removing Crowd Sourced Science, or both FAR and Deadly Reentry will ALSO fix this problem.

More confusing is that loading ONLY notes, CSS, FAR and DR will work just fine. Only problem is, I dont WANT to remove notes.

Below is the opening of my player.log file. The entire file is here

The entire install has been conducted through CKAN, and Im not sure that any permissions issue exists - however I am new to linux so it could very well be the case.
